root.name: list
tip: Display the completions that have been added.
{{ $info.list.example }}

options.name: --remote
options.tip: Display all available completions in the repository ({{ $PSCompletions.url }}).

root.name: add

tip:
Add all completions.
Note: Add many completions may cause PowerShell to load slowly for the start up.
      It's recommended to add what you need.
Add completion. (one or more)
{{ $info.add.example }}

root.name: rm

tip: Remove all completions.
Note: psc will be automatically re-added after removing.
Remove completion. (one or more)
{{ $info.rm.example }}

root.name: update
tip: Update completion. (one or more)
{{ $info.update.example }}
Update all completions that can be updated.
if($PSCompletions.update){ "List: $($PSCompletions.update -join ',')" }
else{'All completions are the latest!'}

root.name: search
tip: Search completion. (Wildcard character can be used)
{{ $info.search.example }}

root.name: which
tip: Locate completion storage location.
{{ $info.which.example }}

root.name: alias
tip:
Manage the alias that triggers completion.
Now it's a list, the initial list is the default trigger name, and you are free to add and remove aliases. (Include the default trigger name)
You can only add aliases without Spaces.
{{ $info.alias.example }}

next.name: add
tip:
Add one or more alias for the specified completion.
Note: It's add, not replace. Original name can also be used.
      If you only want the new alias, you need to remove the original name after adding the new alias.
{{ $info.alias.add.example }}

next.name: rm
tip: Remove completion alias.(one or more)
{{ $info.example.alias.rm.example }}

root.name: config
tip: Get or set the configuration.
{{ $info.config.example }}

next.name: language
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.language }}
Get or set the language of completions.
The language will affect all added completions unless you set a language for one of them by running 'psc completion xxx'.
For more information: https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-language

next.name: zh-CN
tip: Set the language to zh-CN.
if(!$PSCompletions.config.url){
$gitee=$PSCompletions.config.gitee;
if($gitee){ "`nAfter setting to zh-CN, when you add completion, it will be fetched from the Gitee repo. ($($gitee))" }

next.name: disable_cache
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.disable_cache }}
Set whether to disable completion cache.
It usually does not need to be modified.
It's mainly used to debug updates of completion files. (each update will re-read the json file)

Set to 1
Disable completion cache.
It usually does not need to be modified.
It's mainly used to debug updates of completion files. (each update will re-read the json file)

Set to 0 (Default)
Enable completion cache.
It will make the completion load faster, and it's recommended to keep the default.

next.name: update
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.update }}
Set whether to show update message when loading PSCompletions module at first.
Set to 1 (Default)
Show update message when loading PSCompletions module at first.

Set to 0
Don't show update message when loading PSCompletions module at first.
Note: It's not recommended to close it, because it will help you get the latest update information in time.

next.name: module_update

tip: Set to 1 (Default)
Show update message when PSCompletions module has a new version.

Set to 0
Don't show update message when PSCompletions module has a new version.
Note: It's not recommended to close it. The remote repository always matches the latest version of PSCompletions.

next.name: github
tip: $github = $PSCompletions.config.github;
if($github){ "Current Value: $($github)" }else{ 'Github repository is not set.' }
Get or set the remote repository. (Github)
{{ $info.config.github.example }}

next.name: gitee
tip: $gitee = $PSCompletions.config.gitee;
if($gitee){ "Current Value: $($gitee)" }else{ 'Gitee repository is not set.' }
Get or set the remote repository. (Gitee)
{{ $info.config.gitee.example }}

next.name: url

tip: Set to "" (Default)
"": It means using the Github/Gitee repository.

next.name: "https://abgox.github.io/PSCompletions"
tip: An available url.
(Generated by Github Pages)

root.name: completion
menu
tip: Manage the configuration of the completion menu.
{{ $info.menu.example}}

next.name: symbol
tip:
Set the symbol in the completion tip.(😄🤔😎)
The meaning of symbols can be understood through completions. For detailed information, please visit them:
Github: https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-special-symbols
Gitee:  https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-special-symbols

next.name: SpaceTab
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.symbol_SpaceTab }}
Setting it will affect all completion item with this type of symbol.
When it appears in the completion item, it means that after you apply it,
you can press Space and Tab key to continue to get command completions.

Set to ""
It can hide symbols, but it is not recommended that you hide symbols.
It's more recommended that you modify them to your liking.
Because these symbols let you know if you can continue to use Tab for completion.

next.name: WriteSpaceTab
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.symbol_WriteSpaceTab }}
Setting it will affect all completion item with this type of symbol.
When it appears in the completion item, it means that after you apply it,
you can press Space and enter a string, then press Space and Tab key to continue to get command completions.
If the string has Spaces, Please use "" or '' to wrap it. e.g. 'test content'

Set to ""
It can hide symbols, but it is not recommended that you hide symbols.
It's more recommended that you modify them to your liking.
Because these symbols let you know if you can continue to use Tab for completion.

next.name: OptionTab
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.symbol_OptionTab }}
Setting it will affect all completion item with this type of symbol.
When it appears in the completion item, it means that after you apply it (option completion),
you can press Space and Tab key to continue to get option completions. (e.g. --verbose)

Set to ""
It can hide symbols, but it is not recommended that you hide symbols.
It's more recommended that you modify them to your liking.
Because these symbols let you know if you can continue to use Tab for completion.

next.name: line_theme
double_line_rect_border
tip:
Set to a double line rectangular border (default). Be like:
╔═════╗
║     ║

next.name: single_line_rect_border
tip:
Set to a single line rectangular border. Be like:
┌─────┐
│     │

next.name: single_line_round_border
tip:
Set to a single line rounded border. Be like:
╭─────╮
│     │

next.name: color_theme
custom
tip: Customize the style of the completion menu.
{{ $info.menu.custom.example }}

next.name: color
tip: Color-related custom configurations.
{{ $info.example.menu_custom_color }}

next.name: border_text
border_back
item_text
item_back
selected_text
selected_back
filter_text
filter_back
status_text
status_back
tip_text
tip_back
line
tip: Line-related custom configurations.
{{ $info.example.menu_custom_line }}

next.name: horizontal
vertical
top_left
bottom_left
top_right
bottom_right
config
tip: Some other custom configurations for the completion menu.
{{ $info.menu.config.example }}

next.name: enter_when_single
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.enter_when_single }} (Default: 0)
When there is only one completion item, whether to enter it directly instead of displaying the completion menu.

Set to 0 (Default)
Even if there is only one completion item, the menu is displayed first.
You can press the Tab or Space key again to enter the completion item.
Set to 1
When there is only one completion item, it will be entered directly.

next.name: menu_enable
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_enable }} (Default: 1, it means enabled.)
Set whether to use the completion menu provided by the PSCompletions module.
If you are not using PowerShell (pwsh) on a Windows system, it's invalid.
Set to 0
Use PowerShell's built-in completion menu.
Set to 1 (Default)
Use the completion menu provided by the PSCompletions module.

next.name: menu_above_margin_bottom
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_above_margin_bottom }} (Default: 0)
It must be greater than or equal to 0.
Set the distance between the bottom of the menu and the input cursor when the completion menu is displayed above.

next.name: menu_list_cover_buffer
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_list_cover_buffer }} (Default: 0, it means disabled.)
Set whether to overwrite the original content of each line in the area where the completion list is displayed.
(Restores when exiting the complete menu)
If set to 0, only a small area of the content needed for display is overwritten.
Set to 0 (Default)
Only a small area of the content needed for display is overwritten.
Set to 1
Overwrite the original content of each line in the region.

next.name: menu_tip_cover_buffer
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_tip_cover_buffer }} (Default: 1, it means enabled.)
Set whether to overwrite the original content of each line in the area where it is located and its neighboring areas when displaying a completion tip.
(Restores when exiting the complete menu)
Set to 0
Only a small area of the content needed for display is overwritten.
Set to 1 (Default)
Overwrite the original content of each line in the area where it is located and its neighboring areas.

next.name: menu_show_tip
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_show_tip }} (Default: 1, it means enabled.)
Set whether to show the completion tip.
(If the display area of the PowerShell is too small, it automatically hides the completion tip.)
Set to 0
Don't show the completion tip.
Set to 1 (Default)
Show the completion tip.

next.name: menu_trigger_key
tip: 当前值: "{{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_trigger_key }}" (Default: "Tab")
Setting the key that triggers the completion menu. (You should restart PowerShell after changing this configuration.)

next.name: menu_tip_follow_cursor
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_tip_follow_cursor }} (Default: 1, it means enabled.)
Set whether the completion tip is displayed following the input cursor.
Set to 0
Don't follow the input cursor.
Set to 1 (Default)
Follow the input cursor.

next.name: menu_list_follow_cursor
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_list_follow_cursor }} (Default: 1, it means enabled.)
Set whether the completion list is displayed following the input cursor.
Set to 0
Don't follow the input cursor.
Set to 1 (Default)
Follow the input cursor.

next.name: menu_is_prefix_match
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_is_prefix_match }} (Default: 0, it means using fuzzy matching.)
Set whether the menu uses prefix matching mode for completion list filtering.
If use prefix matching mode (set to 1), the common prefix of the current completion list will be automatically extracted.
Set to 0 (Default)
It means using fuzzy matching.

Set to 1
It means using prefix matching.
The common prefix of the current completion list will be automatically extracted.

next.name: menu_above_list_max_count
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_above_list_max_count }} (Default: -1)
Set the maximum number of completion items to be displayed on the first page when the completion menu is displayed above the cursor.
If it's -1, it means to display as many completions as possible according to the available height.
Set to -1 (Default)
Display as many completions as possible according to the available height.

next.name: menu_below_list_max_count
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_below_list_max_count }} (Default: -1)
Set the maximum number of completion items to be displayed on the first page when the completion menu is displayed below the cursor.
If it's -1, it means to display as many completions as possible according to the available height.
Set to -1 (Default)
Display as many completions as possible according to the available height.

next.name: menu_between_item_and_symbol
tip: Current Value: "{{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_between_item_and_symbol }}" (Default: " ")
Set the separator between the completion item and the symbol when there is a symbol after the completion item.
Set to " " (Default)
Add a space between each completion item and symbol.

next.name: menu_selection_with_margin
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_selection_with_margin }} (Default: 1, it means enabled.)
When the margin of the completion list is set, whether the selection style of the currently selected item contains margin.
Set to 0
Don't include margin in the selection style of the currently selected item.
Set to 1 (Default)
Include margin in the selection style of the currently selected item.

next.name: menu_list_min_width
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_list_min_width }} (Default: 10)
Set the minimum width of the completion list area in the completion menu.
Set 10 (Default)
When the width of the completion list area is less than 10, the width will be filled with 10 to avoid menu display errors.

next.name: menu_list_margin_left
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_list_margin_left }} (Default: 0)
Set the spacing between the completion item area and the left border in the completion menu.

next.name: menu_list_margin_right
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_list_margin_right }} (Default: 0)
Set the spacing between the completion item area and the right border in the completion menu.

next.name: menu_status_symbol
tip: Current Value: "{{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_status_symbol }}" (Default: "/")
Set the spacer between the current and total count, which is in the bottom left corner.

next.name: menu_filter_symbol
tip:
Current Value: "{{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_filter_symbol }}" (Default: "[]")
Set the symbols on the left and right of the filter area, which is in the top left corner.
It requires two characters.

next.name: menu_completions_sort
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_completions_sort }} (Default: 1, it means enabled.)
Set whether to dynamically sort the completion list based on command history.
Set to 0
Don't dynamically sort completion list based on command history.
Set to 1 (Default)
Dynamically sort completion list based on command history.

next.name: menu_enhance
tip:
Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_enhance }} (Default 1, it means enabled)
Set whether to override PowerShell's built-in completion menu. (You should restart PowerShell after changing this configuration.)
More info: https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-menu-enhance
           https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-menu-enhance

Set to 0
More info: https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-menu-enhance
           https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-menu-enhance

Set to 1 (Default)
More info: https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-menu-enhance
           https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/README.md#about-menu-enhance

next.name: menu_show_tip_when_enhance
tip: Current Value: {{ $PSCompletions.config.menu_show_tip_when_enhance }} (Default 1, it means enabled)
For completions not added via 'psc add', if there're completion tip, whether to display it.
Set to 0
Don't show the completion tip.
Set to 1 (Default)
Show the completion tip.

root.name: reset
tip: Reset the specified configuration to the default
{{ $info.reset.example }}
Reset the entire PSCompletions module.
Except for the core code of the module, all other content is removed.

next.name: env
tip: Reset some environment configurations.
Include configuration items under the command ('psc config').

next.name: alias
tip: Reset all completions or specified completions to the default completion trigger name.
{{ $info.reset.alias.example }}

next.tip: Reset all completions to the default completion trigger name.

next.name: order
tip:
Reset all order.
It just removes the order sort file, which will be regenerated when the next completion is triggered.
If you do not want to sort by command history, you should disable sorting by running 'psc config menu_completions_sort 0'.

next.name: completion
tip: Reset(Remove) the special configuration of all completions or specified completions.
{{ $info.reset.completion.example }}
Reset(Remove) the special configuration of all completions.
Include all configurations under the command ('psc completion').

next.name: menu
tip: Reset the configuration of the completion menu.
{{ $info.reset.menu.example }}
Reset all configurations of the completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu').

next.name: symbol
tip:
Reset symbols to default values.
SpaceTab      => 😄
WriteSpaceTab => 😎
OptionTab     => 🤔

next.name: line
tip: Rest the line-related configurations of the completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu custom line').

next.name: color
tip: Rest the color-related configurations of the completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu custom color').

next.name: config
tip: Reset other custom configurations of the completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu config').

description:
PSCompletions module's completion tips.
It can only be updated, not removed.
If removed, it will be automatically added again.

desc:
<@Cyan>Current module version: <@Magenta>{{ $PSCompletions.version }}<@Cyan>
Module version log:
  Github: <@Blue>https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/module/CHANGELOG.md<@Cyan>
  Gitee : <@Blue>https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/module/CHANGELOG.md<@Cyan>

<@Blue>PSCompletions<@Cyan> is simple, you just need to enter <@Magenta>psc<@Cyan>, press <@Magenta>Space<@Cyan> and <@Magenta>Tab<@Cyan> key, you will quickly learn all usages by reading the completion tip.
Now, enter <@Magenta>psc add<@Cyan>, press <@Magenta>Space<@Cyan> and <@Magenta>Tab<@Cyan> key, and add the first completion!

<@Blue>PSCompletions<@Cyan> will take up two global names. (<@Yellow>You can't modify them.<@Cyan>)
  <@Magenta>PSCompletions<@Cyan> => A function name. The core function of the module export. (<@Magenta>psc<@Cyan> is actually its alias.)
 <@Magenta>$PSCompletions<@Cyan> => A variable name. Save all information related to the module.

For more information, please visit the project:
  Github: <@Blue>https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions<@Cyan>
  Gitee : <@Blue>https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions<@Cyan>
When you have a problem using it, you can submit an issue. https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/issues
If <@Blue>PSCompletions<@Cyan> is helpful to you, please consider giving it a <@Yellow>Star<@Cyan>.
init_info:
<@Yellow>PSCompletions module install warning (The display is initialized for the first time only):
You should not be in the following case:
  1. Install the PSCompletions module in the built-in Windows PowerShell on the Windows system started in administrator mode.
  2. The installation is accidentally using <@Magenta>-Scope AllUser<@Yellow>
If you are in the case, you should use <@Magenta>-Scope CurrentUser<@Yellow> to reinstall the module, unless you are in the following case:
  1. You already know that the PSCompletions module installed in administrator mode can have permission issues when used with user mode.
  2. You always use the administrator mode to open PowerShell, and never use the user mode.

<@Blue>Full installation command: <@Magenta>Install-Module PSCompletions -Scope CurrentUser<@Cyan>

---------------------------------------------------------------------
<@Cyan>✨✨✨PSCompletions(<@Magenta>psc<@Cyan>) --- init successfully!✨✨✨
<@Yellow>The following is displayed for the first time only, you can also see it by running <@Magenta>psc<@Yellow><@Cyan>
{{ $PSCompletions.info.desc }}

network:
<@Red>Please check your network and try again!
If you are sure that your network is working and you are still getting errors, please submit an issue. ( https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/issues )
err.download_list: <@Red>Failed to get the completions list, please check the network or try again later.
download_file:
<@Red>File {{ Split-path $download_info.url -leaf }} download failed, please check the network or try again later.
Download url: {{ $download_info.url }}
Save path   : {{ $download_info.file }}
If you are sure that your network is working and you are still getting errors, please submit an issue. ( https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/issues )
url:
<@Red>PSCompletions module isn't currently configured with a valid remote repository, you can add it by running the following command.<@Green>
E: psc config github https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions
   psc config gitee https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions
   psc config url https://example.com<@Blue>
Note:
- The <@Magenta>url<@Blue> have a higher priority than <@Magenta>github<@Blue> and <@Magenta>gitee<@Blue>.
- If <@Magenta>url<@Blue> don't set, <@Magenta>github<@Blue> or <@Magenta>gitee<@Blue> is automatically selected based on the <@Magenta>language<@Blue>.
- If <@Magenta>github<@Blue> and <@Magenta>gitee<@Blue> have only one of them set, it will be selected.

update: <@Yellow>Now PSCompletions module can be updated! Update?
(The added completion will be automatically migrated.)
<@Cyan>Press <@Magenta>Enter<@Cyan> key to update or <@Magenta>other key<@Cyan> to cancel!
module.updating:
<@Cyan>Successfully run the command: <@Magenta>Update-Module PSCompletions
<@Cyan>Updating PSCompletions module...

update_info: If you don't want to see it, you can hide it by running <@Blue>psc config update 0 <@Cyan>
But I don't recommend it, it's a good tip.
update_has:
<@Cyan>--------------------
Updatable completions: <@Blue>{{ $PSCompletions.update -join ' ' }}<@Cyan>
You can update them by running the following command:
<@Magenta>psc update *
update_no: <@Green>All the completions are up to date!
sub_cmd: "<@Yellow>You should select a subcommand from the subcommand list below.`n";
info.comp_hide:
⚠️Due to the limited display area size, some completions have been hidden⚠️
You can filter by entering the prefix of the completion and pressing Tab

list.symbol_tip: <@Yellow>🟢: You have added it.   🔴: You haven't added it yet.
example: E: psc list              --- Display a list of locally installed completions
psc list --remote     --- Display remote completions list
E: psc add git            --- Add git
psc add git docker     --- Add git,docker

min: You should continue entering the completion name you want to add.
You can enter more names, separated by spaces.
no:
<@Red>Completion <@Magenta>{{ $completion }}<@Red> does not exist in the completions list.
It's recommended to enter <@Magenta>psc add<@Red>, then press <@Magenta>Space<@Red> and <@Magenta>Tab<@Red> to complete.
Or you can use <@Magenta>psc search<@Red> to search for available completions.

example: E: psc rm git            --- Remove git
psc rm git docker     --- Remove git,docker

min: You should continue entering the completion name you want to remove.
You can enter more names, separated by spaces.

example:
E: psc update                 --- Check update
   psc update *               --- Update all completions
   psc update psc             --- Update psc
   psc update psc git bun     --- Update psc,git,bun

E: psc search *     --- Show all installable completions
   psc search p*    --- Search for completion starting with p in the name
   psc search *p*   --- Search for completion with p in the name

min: You should continue to enter a matching string with *.
If you do not use *, please enter the full name.
ou can also just enter * to see all available completions.

example: E: psc which git            --- Get the location of git
psc which git docker     --- Get the location of git and docker

min: You should continue to enter the name of the completion you want to find the storage location for.
You can enter more names, separated by spaces.

example:
E: psc alias list                 --- List all aliases
   psc alias add git g gi ./g     --- Add g gi ./g as git alias
   psc alias rm g                 --- Remove g alias
done: "<@Magenta>$($completion)<@Green> adds an alias <@Magenta>$($alias)<@Green>, Now <@Magenta>$($completion)<@Green>'s available aliases: <@Magenta>$($PSCompletions.cmd.$completion -join ' ') $($alias)`n<@Yellow>You need to restart PowerShell and re-import the PSCompletions module for the changes to take effect."

"<@Magenta>$($completion)<@Green> removes an alias <@Magenta>$($alias)<@Green>, Now <@Magenta>$($completion)<@Green>'s available aliases: <@Magenta>$(($PSCompletions.cmd.$completion | Where-Object { $_ -ne $alias }) -join ' ')`n<@Yellow>You need to restart PowerShell and re-import the PSCompletions module for the changes to take effect."

example: E: psc alias list     --- List all aliases

tip: {{ "Current aliases: $($PSCompletions.cmd.$completion -join ' ')" }}
Add one or more aliases for {{ $completion }}.
example: E: psc alias add git g gi            --- Add g,gi as git alias
psc alias add scoop scoop.ps1     --- Add scoop.ps1 as scoop alias

min_k: You should continue to enter a completion name that is already installed.
Then enter one or more alias you want to add.
min_v: You need to continue entering one or more alias that you want to add for {{ $completion }}.
err.exist: <@Red>Alias <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Red> is invalid, <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Magenta><@Red> is already an alias for {{ $completion }}.
err.cmd_exist: <@Red>Alias <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Red> is invalid, <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Magenta><@Red> already exists, please set other alias.

rm.tip: Remove one or more aliases for {{ $completion }}.
tip_v: "The alias cannot be removed because it's the only alias of $($completion).`nIf you want to change it, you should first add a new alias for $($completion) and then remove the old alias."
example: E: psc alias rm git g gi            --- Remove aliases (g,gi) for git
psc alias rm scoop scoop.ps1     --- Remove alias (scoop.ps1) for scoop

min_k: You should continue to enter a completion name that is already installed.
Then enter one or more alias you want to remove.
min_v: You need to continue entering one or more alias that you want to remove for {{ $completion }}.
unique: <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Red> cannot be removed because it's the only alias of <@Magenta>{{ $completion }}<@Red>.
If you want to change it, you should first add a new alias and then remove the old alias.

example: E: psc config language               --- Get language
psc config language zh-CN         --- Set to zh-CN

value: <@Magenta>{{ $config_item }}<@Yellow> just need a value, number 1 or 0.

example: E: psc config language           --- Get language
psc config language zh-CN     --- Set to zh-CN
E: psc config disable_cache 1     --- Disable cache
psc config disable_cache 0     --- Enable cache
E: psc config update 1     --- Show completion update
psc config update 0     --- Hide completion update
E: psc config module_update 1     --- Show module update
psc config module_update 0     --- Hide module update

max: <@Magenta>{{ $config_item }}<@Yellow> just need a value, a Github repository. (https://github.com/xxx)

example: E: psc config github                                            --- Get current Github repository
psc config github https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions     --- Set Github repository

max: <@Magenta>{{ $config_item }}<@Yellow> just need a value, a Gitee repository. (https://gitee.com/xxx)

example: E: psc config gitee                                           --- Get current Gitee repository
psc config gitee https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions     --- Set Gitee repository

max: <@Magenta>{{ $config_item }}<@Yellow> just need a value, a url. (https://xxx)
The url must be valid, and its directory structure should be the same as that of the repository.

example: E: psc config url                                           --- Get current url
psc config url https://abgox.github.io/PSCompletions     --- Set url

tip: Set special configuration for {{ $completion }}
Special configurations have higher priority than global configurations.
example:
E: psc completion psc menu_show_tip       --- If it has a value, return the value
   psc completion psc menu_show_tip 0     --- Set psc completion to not display tip
   psc completion psc language en-US      --- Set the psc completion language to zh-CN

min: You should continue to enter the configuration items to be set
By default, each completion comes with two special configurations. (<@Magenta>language<@Yellow>|<@Magenta>menu_show_tip<@Yellow>)

tip: $v = $PSCompletions.config.comp_config.$completion.language;
if($v -notin @('',$null)){ "Current Value: $($v)`n" }
Set the language of {{ $completion }}.
$v = $PSCompletions.config.comp_config.$completion.menu_show_tip;
if($v -notin @('',$null)){ "Current Value: $($v)`n" }
Set whether to display completion tip for {{ $completion }} when using the completion menu provided by PSCompletions module.

example:
E: psc menu config menu_show_tip 0                  --- Hide completion tip
   psc menu symbol SpaceTab ""                      --- Hide symbol
   psc menu line_theme single_line_round_border     --- Toggle the built-in border style theme
   psc menu config                                  --- Set menu configurations

E: psc menu symbol SpaceTab 😄
   psc menu symbol OptionTab 🤔
   psc menu symbol WriteSpaceTab 😎

max: {{ $arg[2] }} just need a value. It can be any symbol you like.

example:
E: psc menu line_theme double_line_rect_border       --- Set to a double line rectangular border (default)
   psc menu line_theme single_line_rect_border       --- Set to a single line rectangular border
   psc menu line_theme single_line_round_border      --- Set to a single line rounded border
done: <@Green>Completion menu border line style modified successfully!

example: E: psc menu color_theme default      --- Default theme
psc menu color_theme magenta      --- Magenta
E: psc menu custom color border_text DarkGray     --- Set foreground color of the border to DarkGray
psc menu custom line horizontal "─"            --- Set the horizontal line of the border to -

E: psc menu config menu_show_tip 0         --- Hide completion tip
   psc menu config menu_enable 0           --- Disable completion menu provided by PSCompletions module
   psc menu config menu_filter_symbol []   --- Set the symbol of the filter area

err.v_0: <@Red>It should be an integer number greater than or equal to<@Magenta>0.
err.v_1: <@Red>It should be an integer number greater than or equal to<@Magenta>1.
err.v_2: <@Red>It should be an integer number greater than or equal to<@Magenta>1, or equal to <@Magenta>-1.
err.v_3: <@Red>It should be the number <@Magenta>1<@Red> or <@Magenta>0<@Red>, which means enabled or disabled.

example:
E: psc reset *                --- Reset PSCompletions module
   psc reset menu symbol      --- Reset all symbols(😄🤔😎)
   psc reset alias psc        --- Reset psc alias
   psc reset completion psc   --- Reset(Remove) this special configuration(language) of psc
init_confirm:
<@Yellow>Reset the PSCompletions module, are you sure?
<@Red>It will delete everything except the module core code.
<@Yellow>If you're sure, please press <@Magenta>Enter<@Yellow> key to continue, or press any other key to cancel.
init_done: <@Yellow>You need to restart PowerShell and re-import the PSCompletions module, which will re-initialize.
done: "<@Green>Reset successfully!`n<@Yellow>If it does not take effect, restart PowerShell and import the module again.`n<@Cyan>Here are the changes from old to new:`n------------------------------`n";
"<@Green>Reset successfully!`n<@Yellow>If it does not take effect, restart PowerShell and import the module again."

example:
E: psc reset alias *               --- Reset all aliases
   psc reset alias psc             --- Reset psc alias
   psc reset alias psc git bun     --- Reset psc git bun alias

E: psc reset completion *              --- Reset(Remove) the special configurations of all completions
   psc reset completion psc            --- Reset(Remove) the special configurations of psc
   psc reset completion psc language   --- Reset(Remove) this special configuration(language) of psc

E: psc reset menu *              --- Reset all menu configurations
   psc reset menu config         --- Reset menu configurations
   psc reset menu line_theme     --- Reset menu border line style

config.name: disable_hooks
tip:
Current Value: <@Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.config.comp_config.psc.disable_hooks}}<@Blue>
Set whether to disable hooks. Default to 0.
The hooks will get the name of the installed or addable completions and add them in completions dynamically.
(e.g. <@Magenta>add<@Blue>, <@Magenta>rm<@Blue>, <@Magenta>update<@Blue>, <@Magenta>completion<@Blue>, <@Magenta>alias<@Blue>...)
For example, enter <@Magenta>psc rm<@Blue>, press <@Magenta>Space<@Blue> and <@Magenta>Tab<@Blue> key,
and you can get some extra completions about the name of the installed completions.
You can disable hooks by running <@Magenta>psc completion psc disable_hooks 1<@Blue>.
